predictit.analyze module¶

This is module for data analysis. It create plots of data, it’s distribution, it’s details, autocorrelation function etc. Matplotlib lazyload because not using in gui.

predictit.analyze.analyze_correlation(data_df)[source]¶

Plot correlation graph.

Parameters

data (np.ndarray) – Time series data

predictit.analyze.analyze_data(array, df, lags=5, window=5)[source]¶

Function that plot data, it’s distribution, some details like minimum, maximum, std, mean etc. It also create autocorrelation and partial autocorrelation (good for ARIMA models) and plot rolling mean and rolling std. It also tell if data are probably stationary or not.

Parameters

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – Time series data.

  • lags (int, optional) – Lags used for autocorrelation. Defaults to 5.

  • window (int, optional) – Window for rolling average and rolling std. Defaults to 5.

predictit.analyze.decompose(data, period=365, model='additive')[source]¶

Plot decomposition graph. Analze if data are seasonal.

Parameters

  • data (np.ndarray) – Time series data

  • period (int, optional) – Seasonal interval. Defaults to 365.

  • model (str, optional) – Additive or multiplicative. Defaults to ‘additive’.
